message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.PL 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Science sub-category of Network and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) as it proposes a novel architecture for a distributed SDN controller that focuses on the distribution of control logic. It also mentions the use of a message bus for interconnecting controllets, which is a common technique used in network architecture. 

The paper could also belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category as it discusses the evolution of SDN control plane architectures towards distributed controllers. 

The System and Control (cs.SY) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper proposes a new architecture for controlling network systems. 

The Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category is another possibility as SDN controllers are often used in security applications, and the paper mentions content-based OpenFlow message filtering, which could be related to security. 

Finally, the Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category is a possibility as the paper mentions the use of light-weight control modules and a micro-kernel approach, which could be related to programming language design.
